title: WANTED: Escaped South Carolina inmate may be in Florida 1 hour ago
content: Source: U.S. Marshals Service    (WEAR) —    U.S. Marshals are looking for an escaped prisoner they say could be in our area.    The U.S. Marshals say 20-year-old Curtis Ray Green, also known as "Ray Ray" was facing murder charges when he escaped from a jail in Orangeburg, South Carolina on May 19 along with two other inmates.    The other two inmates were apprehended in North Carolina.    Green is now facing an escape charge and assault and battery first degree charge.    They believe he could be armed and dangerous.    Green is 5'11" and has the name "Monica" tattooed on his neck and two teardrops tattooed under his left eye.    The U.S. Marshals said Green has ties to South Carolina, North Carolina, New York, and Florida.    A reward of up to $2,500 is being offered for information directly leading to his arrest.
